content.raw:
This looks good, based on my testing. My testing procedure was to run the robots that produce point clouds using each launch file:

1. ```ign launch virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG3 robotName2:=X3 robotConfig2:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG3 robotName3:=X4 robotConfig3:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG2```
2. ```ign launch virtual_stix_headless.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG3 robotName2:=X3 robotConfig2:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG3 robotName3:=X4 robotConfig3:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG2```
3. ```ign launch competition.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG3 robotName2:=X3 robotConfig2:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG3 robotName3:=X4 robotConfig3:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG2```
4. ```ign launch tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG3 robotName2:=X3 robotConfig2:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG3 robotName3:=X4 robotConfig3:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG2```

then  check the ros output using rviz.
